Hal::Pio Class Reference

Documentation

This class controls pin input/output.

See also
Hal::Pin

Example:

#include <stfy/Hal.hpp>
int main(int argc, char * argv[]){
//This allocates a PIO object but does not affect HW state
Pio pio(2); //use pio port 2
//This opens the port and sets the attributes -- same as pio.open(); pio.setattr(1<<10, PIO_MODE_OUTPUT);
pio.init(1<<10, PIO_MODE_OUTPUT);
//Bits can be manipulated using clrmask() and setmask()
pio.clrmask(1<<10); //clear bit 10 of port 2
pio.setmask(1<<10); //set bit 10
//the pin can be reconfigured as an input
pio.setattr(1<<10, PIO_MODE_INPUT | PIO_MODE_PULLDOWN); //set as an input with internal pulldown
//get() is used to read the port
if( pio.get() & (1<<10) ){
//bit 10 is set
}
//This closes the port for all instances (ports are closed automatically when program exits)
pio.close();
}

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator
NONE 

Specifies No PIO event

RISING 

Specifies a rising edge on the PIO

FALLING 

Specifies a falling edge on the PIO

BOTH 

Specifies both edges on the PIO

anonymous enum
Enumerator
INPUT 

Input mode

OUTPUT 

Output mode

FLOAT 

Input mode floating (| with INPUT)

PULLUP 

Input mode pullup (| with INPUT)

PULLDOWN 

Input mode pulldown (| with INPUT)

OPENDRAIN 

Output mode open drain (| with OUTPUT)

REPEATER 

Input mode repeater (| with INPUT)

HYSTERESIS 

Use hysteresis (| with INPUT)

Member Function Documentation

int Hal::Pio::init ( pio_sample_t  mask,
int  mode 
)
inline

Initialize the port.

This method opens the port then sets the attributes using the specified mask and mode.

Pio p(0);
p.init((1<<10)|(1<<5), PIO_MODE_OUTPUT)); //pins 0.5 and 0.10 are outputs
int Hal::Pio::set_action ( const pio_action_t *  action)

Set the action for the port using pio_action_t

int Hal::Pio::set_action ( u32  channel,
u32  event,
s8  prio = 0,
mcu_callback_t  callback = 0,
void *  context = 0 
)
inline

Set the action for an event

Parameters
channelThe channel (pin) to fire the event
eventNONE, RISING, FALLING, or BOTH
callbackA privileged function to execute when the event happens (can be null) (return zero to delete the callback association)
contextThe first argument passed to the callback
Returns
Zero on success
